channel.title: [tut] simple status checker VB
channel.description:
This is made 100% by me.
Step one: make your form and make a label named label1 (do your design etc.)
Step two: right click the tab thing=>componets=>msinet then click the inet1 on your form then goto form_load code and add this under it
[code] If inet1.OpenURL("127.0.0.0.1") = True Then Label1.Text = "Online" Else Label1.Text = "Offline" ' ip is your server [/code]
and that's it, this is off the top of my head tell me if doesnt work.
oh and if you can't find the msinet, type this in command prompt:
[code] regsvr32 c:\windows\system32\msinet.ocx [/code]

item.title: [tut] simple status checker VB
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

Drunk On Java:

Because not all people have winsock and it preduces errors if you don’t.

People who don’t have the Winsock ActiveX won’t have the Inet control either…

You need to use Winsock directly if you wan’t it to be compatible with people who don’t have all the controls that come with VB.

Read full topic

Read full topic

item.title: [tut] simple status checker VB
item.dc:creator: @Xabbyx Xabbyx
item.description:
@Xabbyx wrote:

You guys are dumb!!!
i dont know, how could you write: Label1.TEXT!!! NOOOO!!
its Label1.CAPTION!!! LOOOOL!!!

Wait, ill create a new tutorial, Drunk On Java, please edit your post:

  1. Rightclick at the toolbox…
  2. Press Component…
  3. Check the Checkbox: Microsoft Internet Transfer Control 6.0, press ok
  4. Press the new component you added, and drag it to your form
  5. Add a label, standard called Label1
  6. Double-Click the form, and add this code:

If Inet1.OpenURL(“0.0.0.0.0”) = True Then
Label1.Caption = “Online”
Else
Label1.Caption = “Offline”
End If

Remember to edit the (“0.0.0.0.0”) to a valid ip

Read full topic

item.title: [tut] simple status checker VB
item.dc:creator: @pkedpker pkedpker
item.description:
@pkedpker wrote:

because if you want to use it gotta know about vb sytnax
this:
If inet1.OpenURL(“127.0.0.1”) = True Then Label1.Text = “Online” Else Label1.Text = “Offline” ’ ip is your server

would be
If inet1.OpenURL(“127.0.0.1”) = True Then
Label1.Text = “Online”
Else
Label1.Text = “Offline” ’ ip is your server
end if

or notice the ‘:’ character
If inet1.OpenURL(“127.0.0.1”) = True Then Label1.Text = “Online” Else: Label1.Text = “Offline” ’ ip is your server
or better yet you could of used a ternary expression like
iif(inet1.OpenURL(“127.0.0.1”),label1 = “Online”,label1 = “Offline”)

edit:
also note labels don’t have .text property they use .caption

Read full topic

item.title: [tut] simple status checker VB
item.dc:creator: @hazorduz hazorduz
item.description:
@hazorduz wrote:

for the VB6 people:
The codes a bit stuffed here is the fixed FORM load code

Private Sub Form_Load() If Inet1.OpenURL("YOURSCAPE.no-ip.org") = True Then status.Caption = "YOURScape is Online" Else status.Caption = "YOURScape is Offline" ' edit out "YOURSCAPE.no-ip.org" with your server ip End Sub
Thanks,
Hazorduz.

Read full topic
